item.title: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I don’t troll, if i wanted an argument i’d email my Ex

Got a serious question though, why didn’t they just fudge it with something like…(just a suggestion)…

“sorry folks the chinese have fucked runescape, we had to take out the wilderness, so any players that still want to hack each other to death for no apparent reason will have to follow new rules until we learn how to ban annonymous proxies and regional networks.”
New rules:
If grave_in_wilderness AND grave_collapses then spawn FUCK_ALL
If in_wilderness AND grave_exists And HP=0 then spawn FUCK_ALL

It’s a quick and simple fix, you have BH for people who want to profit and you could even replace the spawn FUCK_ALL with stupid tokens, redeemable for non tradable TAT.
It would’ve had less of an impact on skills and general gameplay than the shit they came out with. The games so fucking boring now.

jagex == Lamers

Read full topic

item.title: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

MrPotatoHead:

They might risk having an 18+ certificate on runescape?

Because god forbid that we have low poly models swinging crappy-ass animated swords at each other and then one of the player models collapses into a fetal position.

For fucks sake, children’s televension shows are more violent than runescape, I mean honestly, is this what the gaming industry’s coming to? Abiding by ‘regulations’ written by fat old farts who know nothing about games or the target market? It’s like trying to put children in a giant plastic bubble where the only thing allowed to enter are rainbows and butterflies.

/rant

Anyway, yea. I doubt they’ll bring the wilderness back, whatever the true reason behind removing it was.

Read full topic
item.source: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?

item.title: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I stand corrected, by licence i meant their ability to publish? a game.

the Guardian – 9 Feb 08

Ministers plan clampdown on 'unsuitable' video games

· New rating scheme devised· Keep computers out of bedrooms, parents told

That would apply to online games and companies that run them, you don’t even need legislation to become a target, imagine if runescape was used as an example, that would be too much bad publicity, especially as it can be linked to at least one teen death already.

" if they depict, to any significant extent, gross violence against humans or animals".
I know the wilderness didn’t seem excessivly violent to you, but then i doubt your a fat, illegitimate snob that’s paid 100k a year to talk bollocks.

If the axe is falling, you get out of the way.

I bet you can come up with several anti-RWT ways to bring the wilderness back so that children can stand there blatently killing each other for no reason, it’s just not going to happen, they would do it already. They might risk having an 18+ certificate on runescape?

It’s just my opinion that RWT was an excuse to remove PKing.

Read full topic

item.source: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?

item.title: Is jagax ever going to release Wilderness again?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“MrPotatoHead, post:8, topic:219871”]Answer is No

Personally i don’t think they got rid of it because of RWT, that was just an excuse.

The UK goveenment adopted a policy of getting rid of all unadulterated violence in games, ie you can kill a monster but you can’t just go kill someone for no reason. Google ‘Manhunt 2’
For jagex to keep their licence they would need to comply with this policy, simply because they are a UK game company.

So if it PKing is part of a mini game with rewards, it’s ok.

Question is, Would jagex ever own up to this policy?[/quote]

What on earth are you talking about? Manhunt 2 had nothing to do with “the government” per se, what happened was the BBFC refused to issue a certificate (even an 18+) so it could not be sold. Rockstar appealed through the VAC (also not really “the government”, although an organisation set up in response to a law, so about as close to a government body as this case got) - the VAC denied the appeal. It was then taken to court, which Rockstar won, and Manhunt 2 is sold as an 18+ game in the UK right now and always will be. The High Court ruled that Manhunt 2’s violence was no different to violence seen in other games and therefore it CAN be sold… they certainly didn’t rule that no game can ever have human-on-human violence in it, that would be silly.

I’m also not sure what you mean by Jagex losing their “license”. You don’t need to be licensed to be a video game company, our country is not YET that absurd (although hell, I wouldn’t be surprised if its coming)

EDIT: Slight fix, the VAC is in fact a government body (the BBFC isn’t, though)- thanks wikipedia

Read full topic
